title: 109_hr2995
content: The "Weather Modification Research and Technology Transfer Authorization Act of 2005" aims to establish a national policy and program for weather modification research and development. The Act defines key terms such as Board, Executive Director, research and development, and weather modification as part of establishing a national policy and program for weather modification research and development. The Act establishes a national policy and program for weather modification research and development, which involves artificially changing or controlling the natural development of atmospheric cloud or precipitation forms in the troposphere. The Weather Modification Advisory and Research Board is established under Section 4 of the Act. The Weather Modification Advisory and Research Board, established in the Department of Commerce, consists of 11 members appointed by the Secretary of Commerce, including representatives from various organizations such as the American Meteorological Society and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. The Weather Modification Advisory and Research Board, under the Department of Commerce, consists of 11 members appointed by the Secretary of Commerce. Members include representatives from institutions of higher education, research institutes, and states supporting weather modification projects. Board members serve at the pleasure of the Secretary and vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Board may establish advisory committees to advise on legislation, policies, administration, research, and other matters. The Board must hold its first meeting within 30 days of all members being appointed. The Board, consisting of 11 members appointed by the Secretary of Commerce, will hold its first meeting once all members are appointed. Meetings will be called by the Chair, with a majority of members needed for a quorum. The Board will select a Chair and Vice Chair from its members. The Board, consisting of 11 members appointed by the Secretary of Commerce, will have duties outlined in Section 5. The Board will promote research and development in weather modification, including improved technologies and assessments of efficacy. Financial assistance will be provided from the Weather Modification Research and Development Fund. The Board will use funds for administration and research on weather modifications through grants or contracts with public or private agencies. A biennial report on findings and research results will be submitted to the Secretary of Commerce. The Board has powers related to weather modification research and administration. The Board has the authority to conduct studies, investigations, and hearings, employ necessary personnel, cooperate with other agencies, and enter into cooperative agreements for weather modification activities. The Executive Director, with Board approval, may conduct or contract for research and development activities related to weather modification. SEC. 7. The US government and other agencies must support the Weather Modification Operations and Research Board. They should also initiate research programs on weather modifications. SEC. 8. Funding. The Weather Modification Research and Development Fund is established within the Treasury of the United States to receive appropriations and gifts for weather modification research. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2006 to 2015, with funds remaining available until expended. The Board may also accept gifts or donations of services or property.
